alert.note: Alert for Essex; Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 03 at 2:52PM EDT until May 04 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River Above Singac affecting Morris, Essex, and Passaic Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Passaic River Above Singac. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.5 feet, Portions of the Wayne Town Center parking lot begin to flood. Hobson Avenue and Riverlawn Drive in Wayne begin to flood. Fairfield Road, Fayette Avenue, and Riversedge Road in Wayne can flood as water backs up the Pompton River. Lincoln Boulevard in Lincoln Park can also flood due to backwater up the Pompton river. The Pequannock River Park also floods. At 9.0 feet, Two Bridges Road in Fairfield is subject to closures. At 9.5 feet, Camp Lane and Marginal Road in Fairfield begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 9.2 feet and continues to fall slowly. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:45 PM EDT Wednesday was 9.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Thursday and continue falling to 6.8 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.3 feet on 04/10/2022. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (2 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date Passaic River Singac 8.5 9.2 Wed 1 pm 8.0 7.2 MSG unknown &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 300 AM EDT.
